wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Philip "Woody" Woods-Scawen  (29 June 1916 – 1 September 1940) was a Royal Air Force officer who flew during the Battle of Britain and as such was one of "The Few".

response: On 1 September 1940 Woods-Scawen's brother, Patrick Woods-Scawen, was shot down in combat with Bf 109s in the Kenley area; he baled out but was killed when his parachute failed. His body was not found until 6 September in the grounds of The Ivies, Kenley Lane.
